newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: FOCUS-ICI Australia buy-back given go-ahead.
newsitem.headline: FOCUS-ICI Australia buy-back given go-ahead.

text.p: Minority shareholders of chemicals group ICI Australia Ltd on Wednesday approved a plan to buy back up to 10 percent of the company's shares from its British parent, Imperial Chemical Industries Plc.
A meeting of around 300 shareholders voted overwhelmingly to support the buy-back, which could cost as much as A$360 million.
The buy-back forms part of ICI Plc's intention to sell its 62.4 percent interest in its Australian subsidiary.
ICI Plc aims to sell the rest of its shares through a public offer to Australian retail and global institutional investors.
The retail offer opened on Wednesday.
The parent's total stake is worth almost A$2.4 billion at the current market price.
ICI Australia shares were trading at A$12.91 at 0345 GMT on Wednesday, down nine cents on Tuesday's strong close.
ICI Australia will borrow the funds needed to complete the buy-back, but an independent expert concludes the exercise will still raise earnings per share by at least about two percent.
